trans-unit.source: Assigns an item type to an element in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List"></xref> or <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList"></xref> control's child controls.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

When a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.List> or <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ObjectList> control is rendered in templated mode, empty <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem> objects with the corresponding item type are created for each header, footer, or separator that needs to be rendered.
These empty objects are then inserted into the control's child controls.
<xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem> objects that correspond to list items always have a type of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItem>.

You can use this enumeration for iterating through the controls collection and finding the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem> objects corresponding to the header, footer, and separator templates.
Represents a footer for a list.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Represents a heading for a list.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Represents an item in a list.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Represents a separator between list items.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
